item.title: Continued noise from ironwork, 13th December
item.description:
This noise has continued to get louder when driven over waking people up throughout the night / day This has been ongoing for weeks now and no one will sort it seems ?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Greenwood Drive, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary crossing lights too near to Temporary roundabout, 12th December
item.description:
Temporary roundabout at junction of Cheltenham road and old Cheltenham road has a temporary pedestrian crossing near to it which shows a green light and vehicles think this green light is to carry on straight along Cheltenham as a normal traffic light and they do not see the roundabout. This has caused a few incidents of near collision with some cars using the roundabout correctly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: Poor road markings and limited visibility in all the roadworks., 12th December
item.description:
Heading south down the hill from the old Air Balloon roundabout towards the M5 where the roadworks are, there are faded road marks, traffic cones covered in mud and muck, confusing cones in the dark make it appear the road goes in a different direction, and there's no lighting or clear signage. Even the arrow placed to help avoid a concrete barrier isn't visible at night as it's covered in so much road muck. It is an accident waiting to happen. Additional night lights and cleaned cones would help guide drivers on that dark stretch of road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold Way, Birdlip, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cones and temporary signage - still required, 12th December
item.description:
Between Bishops Cleeve and Oxenton on the A435 there appears to be sections of cones and temporary signs that appear to no longer be serving a purpose - signs facing down into grass verge, cones separated from their bases etc. Are these still necessary - if not can these be cleared?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is misaligned (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Poor ‘repair’ a few weeks ago has been washed away and problem remains, 12th December
item.description:
Potholes both sides of the lane were reported. One was ‘fixed’ apparently by just putting a few spade loads of tarmac in the centre of the hole. This has now been washed away as the water runs through the lengthy pothole. Nothing appears to have been done to repair the other side of the lane at this point which is now breaking up more seriously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
NWD with give an take plus 15 minutes delay boards needed best out of hours carriageway pothole 900x500x70mm tarmac patch required please use cold lay or bucket tarmac due to traffic signal cable present best out of hours (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken tree sticking out into road, 12th December
item.description:
A tree has broken/fallen on the left side as you drive up Birdlip Hill. A branch is poking out into the road. When cars are coming the other way, a large vehicle cannot avoid hitting the branch. Please can it be removed/cut back. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
